reviews.text:
Always a great time. My favorite place to play some black jack. Mary who has been with them is fantastic dealer. Since 1989 to be exact! 

I’ve also stayed here for a week last year and that was also a fantastic visit as well. Highly suggest staying here!

What a great hotel and casino!

The rooms are beautiful, the casino was a ton of fun, and the cravings buffet was delicious.

Everything across the board (for the most part) felt modern and up to date.

The hotel suite was spacious, and clean. Having a walk in closet as well a separate room for the toilet for showering and bathing was amazing.

The casino was a lot of fun, even if we did leave Vegas a bit in the negative. Carl (one of the security guards) was a definite highlight. He came by randomly, asked if we were celebrating any birthdays.. We were, and he sang to her! Great voice, and greater personality! He went on to thank us for being guests as well. It was great! Thanks Carl!

The only issue we ran into while at the mirage was when we went to see the dolphins.. The gentleman running the centre ticket booth Sunday morning was very rude with us.

The pool is one of the best on the strip. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the bed was comfortable as well. Quickly becoming one of my favorites on the strip!Always a great time. My favorite place to play some black jack. Mary who has been with them is fantastic dealer. Since 1989 to be exact! A great place to stay--and in the middle of the strip! Overall a great experience. The room was clean and stylish. The staff were delightful to chat with and made great recommendations on dining and entertainment other than gambling.

I have been to most of the hotels in the strip and I absolutely loved staying here. The location is fabulous. The service and atmosphere is fabulous. I've eaten at three of the restaurants and enjoyed the food at each of them. The pool is one of the best on the strip. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the bed was comfortable as well. Quickly becoming one of my favorites on the strip!

Rooms were very nice and clean. Casino was nicely laid out and was a fun time. Food was good through the hotel/casino as well. Spa area was very very nice. Lost a star for me because the cocktail service was extremely slow while gambling, and the waitresses were not that humble or nice.

The water show is a must if you’re in Vegas, it’s so nice to see how it moves with the music. Considering a lot goes on in Vegas, this is very family friendly. It also makes a great place to take photos and videos. Make sure you show up a little bit earlier between shows to ensure you have a good spot to view the show, each time it’s a different song so you know you’ll get a unique experience every time you go see it.

Amazing sprinklers and beautiful theme which plays along with the music. It runs for five minutes and is very mesmerizing to watch. Watch it in the evenings as the lighting plays a very good role in enhancing the experience. I watched it from the Eiffel Tower also and I felt the view and the experience from above is very good. Recommend to watch it in the evenings to experience the beauty.

Absolutely beautiful. The water is a stunning crystal blue and the fountains are impressive. Loved that the show I caught at 3:30pm (Sunday) was set to "All That Jazz" from Chicago the musical. The theater geek in me giggled like a school girl. Definitely one of the things you want to see when visiting the Strip.

I think some people are rating the restaurant...this is just for the actual fountains. The fountain show is awesome. It’s a beautiful sight. Goes on every 15 minutes. We stayed and watched multiple shows! It is mesmerizing!
Such a fun show and a great tourist attraction. Honestly it never gets old. The shows are amazing. Definitely a cool spectacle. Highly recommend stopping by to see a show.

Paris Resort in Las Vegas is incredible. We loved the openness of the main floor. The trip up there Eiffel Tower is well worth the money. The gentlemen, Ernest I believe, who we met at the elevator ride up was mind blowing. The facts and numbers that he knows about the entire Vegas area is crazy. Totally enjoyed our afternoon at Paris Resort.

This is a great way to see Las Vegas, and the strip area from  up above. It is located at the Paris Casino Hotel property. The price is very reasonable. I went during the day, and had a great view of the Bellagio water fountains. I would definitely go up to this observation deck again, probably at night to see all the lights and the fountain show.

I’ve been to Vegas several times, but this was the first time I went to the top of the Eiffel Tower. It was awesome! We didn’t have to wait too long for a ride up the elevator. The elevator operator tells you what you are seeing on the way up, and there’s another staff member on the viewing deck to answer questions. It’s all caged, so it would be impossible to fall. It’s a great 360 degree view of the Vegas strip. There are telescopes you can pay to look through, but I didn’t feel the need. The view overlooks the Bellagio. We were able to watch the Bellagio fountain show from above, which was pretty neat. I think the only thing that may have made the experience better would be coming at night in the dark- I will do that next time! Definitely worth the price. The experience is not available during inclement weather, so plan accordingly!
Great view from the restaurant but unfortunately the food just wasn’t all that for the price. I have had better steak for a tenth of the price. Wouldn’t eat here again
Great view! Especially at night. You can see the entire strip in all it's lit up glory

I was surprised by how nice this place was, considering it is a free attraction. They had quite a few birds here that you wouldn't normally get to see. In addition to flamingos, there were pelicans, a black swan, some unusual looking ducks, and many koi fish. Great place to bring kids, relax, and take pics. Beautiful!
Beautiful area with so many different species of birds / ducks. The flamingos were very cool! Great place to relax and enjoy some wildlife in the middle of Vegas.

As bird people, this was one of our favorite parts of our trip people! It's very nice green scenery in the heart of the strip. The employees that work in this area are very knowledgeable on the animals. Very good photo opportunities here!

It's a free public place inside the flamingo hotel next to the buffet nice to take your kids to see koi fish, turtles ducks and of course flamingos, they can even see how do they feed them and learn a little bit more of them in the morning presentations. There's seats and a beautiful fountain where you can relax hearing the live music from a know bar the only thing fountain is a smoking area

Love visiting, Love admiring the fish and all the other residents of the Habitat. I really enjoy stopping at the bricks that have been engraved with the names of those wonderful people that got married and donated their brick..
This was a very fun experience. It was really big and lots of superstars were there. I would  highly recommend taking a camera with you because you can take beautiful photos. 🤳

Madame Tussauds Amsterdam is the cool place to visit. It's very well organized. They also have captain marvel theme for kids and for the Marvel fans. They have nice art work and statue of lot of famous celebrity from film industry, music industry , sports industry. It was nice visit.
Great place. Worth a visit. Expensive but I guess it is not cheap to make and perhaps even royalties paid for the characters and figures. Children loved it too.

Had a lot of fun in this place. We went in January and it was mostly empty which was nice. Lots of interactive displays and cool things to look at. It was better than I expected. Go during off hours; I could see this place not being nearly as good if it were crowded.

Fun! Most of the wax figures look quite young so might need to be updated at some point. First Madame Tussauds I've been to. Sent a photo of me with Ryan Gosling to a friend and found out by chance she was in Amsterdam too so that was a wonderful surprise 😂

Arrived to check-in at 7:20pm, was finally helped at 8:05pm. There are 7 staff members checking in folks. There are 17 check-in stations. They really need to up their staffing during these peak times. At check-in they highly suggest upgrading to elite rooms. Same size rooms, with nicer bedding, a fridge and bigger TV. Up too you if that's worth it. Not a bigger size or anything like that.

I have an oversized van so had to park across the street. Easy access, much appreciated. It was really neat to be walking up to the hotel and hear the screams of someone jumping over the edge (their skyfall attraction).

I noticed an ad for a rotating restaurant at the top. I hope to try it before I leave.

The casino is pretty standard fare, nothing special.

The Stratosphere is fun, a little bit pricey but if you like adventure it's worth it. We only went for the rides on the top and to jump off the side of the tower. We had a blast but also realized that we are adrenalin junkies and need more for it to be amazing. Don't get me wrong most people would call this an adrenalin rush! If you like feeling like a kid again, or are looking for a fun, but totally different way to get your night started I would recommended going!

Paid for a 10 day stay and was treated so poorly within those ten days. If we were able to cancel and stay somewhere else we would have... The first night we were here one of the dealers "Ralph" made me feel EXTREMELY UNCOMFORTABLE by hitting on me while I was standing with my boyfriend. My boyfriend told him that what he said was extremely disrespectful and unprofessional. The so called "pit boss" came over and when my boyfriend told him what Ralph said, he didn't say a word to us, no apologies or anything! Then the second day after room service came into our room my boyfriend's very expensive razor went missing we shrugged it off and assumed it was our fault. Few days later after our room was serviced again his deodorant went missing, again we shrugged it off. Few days later he goes to shave his face while having to hold his razor blade in his hand and his shaving cream is now gone. 3 times?! That was no coincidence. Fortunately the nicest person yet a manager named Riley made it right by crediting money back to our card to cover the cost of the items. We would gamble for quite awhile before bartenders would even come near us, most the time they just walked by ignoring us. Best part about this place is the free water you get while gambling if you can manage to get a cocktail server to get it.

The Stratosphere is fun, a little bit pricey but if you like adventure it's worth it. We only went for the rides on the top and to jump off the side of the tower. We had a blast but also realized that we are adrenalin junkies and need more for it to be amazing. Don't get me wrong most people would call this an adrenalin rush! If you like feeling like a kid again, or are looking for a fun, but totally different way to get your night started I would recommended going!

The staff was extremely helpful with no issues.  My only complaint was the time it took to check in on Thursday after 11pm. It took over an hour since the line was so long. This hotel and Casino had everything in it that if we didn't want to, we didn't have to go out for anything.  Rooms were very clean so I must shout out to the Housekeeper that cleaned room 11020 on the Select elevators side from 4/11-4/14/2019. She did an awesome job.  The buffet was great also.

Best hotel in old Vegas. I love the nugget and the old charm. The staff is friendly and helpful and we just can’t get enough of the tank in the pool area. So fun! The rooms are clean and the hotel is meticulously maintained inside and out. The casino staff are friendly and the front desk staff are so great and accommodating. We have already booked our return to this hotel on our next trip to Vegas.

If anybody is trying to find good deals for hotels visit HotelBuIly. com booked a hotel on there and they had the best rates anywhere!

Stayed in the Golden Tower! The room was Outstanding! They have a great club upstairs Troy Liquor Bar that overlooks Fremont St. Service was excellent at the front desk. The property is amazing! I cant wait to try out the water slide that goes through the aquarium. Old Vegas is way cool!

Great place to stay if you want to get away from the strip. First time staying off of the strip and it was a great experience. Affordable places to eat and a decent pool to go with it. Walk out the front doors of the casino and you're on Fremont Street! Always something to do, or just people watch! Would definitely stay here again

We had a very nice experience at The Golden Nugget. The room was well kept and comfortable. The swimming pool is very unique with a large shark tank in the center! There is dining, shopping and a casino. It’s located on Fremont street so there is always something fun going on just outside the doors of the resort. Check in was easy and parking is free for those staying at the resort. We will definitely be back!

I did not give 5 stars for a reason.  Twice I kindly asked the housekeepers to freshen my room.  My bed did not even get made.  (Not once in my entire 3 night visit) The cosmetic mirror was dirty from the last occupant?   Ugh!!.  I love staying downtown, but when I book again I will not be staying at Carson Tower.  To be fair, the food at. Vic & Anthony's was amazing.  Jose the bartender is a terrific gem off a soul.  The steak was wagu beef and the best if my life.  The ambiance is warm and comfy.

Very nice place to visit with the whole family, great playgrounds for kids with lots of open spaces to run and attractions to play. Just be aware that if you come with kids you have to leave after 9pm. They have very comfy booths and chairs all around and a small concert venue where local artist perform with good sound and light equipments. Excellent restaurants and bars, where only small local business are allowed, kudos for supporting our locals. At the entry you'll enjoy the show of a fire throwing giant Praying Mantis, really fun to watch specially once is dark. Dome cinema showing short films, very cool. This is just 3 blocks away from The Fremont street and very convenient parking just around the corner. Visit this place and you won't be disappointed.

Cool place to take the kids. Plenty of play areas for them to run around in, especially the tree house. Eclectic and artsy craft shops to visit. A variety of craft foods and beverages to enjoy.  Magical looking at night with all the lights on. The praying mantis that welcomes you at the entrance can be startling. In the evening it comes alive.

Awesome outdoor venue that supports young artists in downtown Las Vegas. Plenty of awesome food around too, this place smells awesome the second you start walking in towards the stage area. Cool seating also, get there early for your event as there are only a few places to sit. Great place to bring the kids for some music, good, and fun outside.

This place is super cool. Great "adult tree house". We had lots of fun checking it the shops and watching the praying mantis throw fire balls in the air. Lots of bins to check out for shopping, eating, drinking, and even a cigar bar. There's also a nice stage and lawn area to just chill and enjoy the show. You can even get tatted in one of the containers. Only a couple of blocks off of Fremont so if you are in the area, definitely check it out.

We were in Las Vegas when we ran into this unique place. With so many people using container modules for homes, why not use them to make a mall. The place itself is eye catching and quite a nice bit of architecture. The mall has a modern feel to it. It does have a playground for children. I will admit that there were only a few store and lots of empty spaces. The mall itself has two level but once again there were many empty spaces. However I still find it fascinating to build a mall with containers. The best thing about this place is the Flame throwing praying mantis at the entrance of the mall. We did not have a problem with parking at all.

   Overall it's a fascinating and unique place to visit and fun to watch the praying mantis. Unfortunately there really is not to many stores here so shopping is non existent. I would have to agree that this would be a great place for families with young children due to the play area and praying mantis.

This was a surprising good find in Downtown Las Vegas! I think it was one of my favorite places in downtown. We arrived several hours early to the Fremont Experience, so we decided to go here since it was a short block or two away. 

 Wow! It was very informative. The interactive design, small films and different information displays in different areas always gets your interest and everything is nice. Some things were repeated a lot over the floors, but overall it was very good. 

Also, the ammount of original artifacts recovered and in display was quite surprising. It's obvious that this was a big effort to out together.

The staff is SUPER NICE. I absolutely loved them.

We like to read everything and soak in the facts and details, so we were inside for about 2.5 hours. Even though we entered around 5 or 6, the rooms were quite full with people and everyone was super engaged. 

Worth every dollar!! Definitely a must see if you're in the area.

Great place to visit, and an incredible gift shop.  Had a great time doing the shoot/don't shoot experience.  Very friendly and knowledgeable staff.  You can easily spend a half-day here.  Loved the old Post office building that it was in.

We checked this out on the last day of our trip to Vegas and were unsure how good it would be. However, it turned out to be one of the most memorable parts of the whole trip! The museum is not only interesting but very engaging (with lots of seats and benches!). We also tried out two of the experience packages - the lab experience and the police training. The staff supervising these experiences were knowledgeable and approachable. Would definitely recommend!!

Lots of entertaining history contained here. If you want to see everything and read all the cards posted inside you will need several hours. But fun hours. From the rise on the streets to high level power and all the glitz and violence in between. Very interesting tour. And they have no idea where Jimmy Hoffa is either.
The bar was a great touch! Very speakeasy themed. Live music was phenomenal. Cocktails were great. Riki took care of me, my girlfriend and her cousin. Will be back and hope he'll be there!

This was a fun place to soak up some Las Vegas history you don't always hear about. It definitely filled in some gaps in my knowledge about the history of the area. The movie was interesting, and the displays informative. Me and my parents walked around the old fort afterwards for about 15 minutes. I'd definitely recommend it if you want a change of scenery from the Strip.
$3 entry fee for 12+. It was fun to see how Vegas got started and how they used to live in the mid 1800s.

Very interesting place, site of the first permanent European settlement in the vegas valley. Small state park in the city limits of vegas. Not much of the original buildings left, but the did a good job making it close to original as possible. Interesting exhibits and displays

This is a nice historical site to visit to understand the origins of Las Vegas. The museum has interesting information and is laid out well. It is also only $1 entry for adults which is very reasonably priced. The fort itself isn't much to look at but I enjoyed imagining what it would've been like in 1855.
If you like history, then you will like this cool museum about Las Vegas. It was 3 dollars per person when I went in 2019.

We love this place and get a membership each year. This is such a great place to take the kids! There is a little playground to break up seeing all the cool stuff. Membership also gets you discounts on things like the butterfly exhibit and train rides. Thursdays have Toddler Time at 11 which I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

My family and I love the spring preserves. We had a mini photoshoot after church here in the botanical garden. There are a lot of things you can do at the preserve. The butterfly garden was a neat experience. Their is also a train ride and a museum that we didn't get a chance to do but definitely will on the next visit. Our most favorite part of the preserve was the botanical garden. Since we are used to a lot of trees and flowers this botanical garden was by far one of our most liked gardens. We like the variety of cacti and trees they had to offer some of the cacti were surprisingly very tall. I liked that they offered seats around the garden that you could sit back and relax at. Another perk was that the seats were in shaded areas. The only downfall I would say is that you have to pay for admissions and other attractions inside the park. Other than that it's a nice place for a family day and it's kid friendly.

Big place to visit.  Had a wonderful time in the many museums and hands on exhibits!  Wonderful green space and butterfly house.  Great for a family adventure with fun things to do for all ages!!  Even the cafe was good food and reasonable prices.  Loved the Boomtown remake of Las Vegas, so cute and educational.  Prices were very reasonable, but would recommend a family membership, as you save ten percent with discount on tickets.

Lovely natural history museum and grounds. The botanical gardens were by far my favorite feature as the flowers just filled the air with fragrance. Nice play ground for the kids. Lots to learn and explore here. The 'train' was a bit squeaky, but it was not badly priced. It was a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the rest of Vegas and great to be outside on a beautiful day. Definitely recommended!

I was very pleasantly surprised with the springs preserve. It is very clean, well maintained and high quality musuem/garden. The kids had a blast and we could barely keep up with them. The exhibits were interesting and very well done. I loved how interactive everything was, kept the kids attention the whole time. The butterfly exhibit was nice but a little underwhelming. Overall a great experience, will be back soon.

Nice variety of Asian eatery venues, but we couldn't find a Japanese sushi restaurant, even though an online search indicated one was there. Only a couple venues were open on the second floor. There was a good boba-tea shop and bakery in the mall. Parking was no problem on a Sunday evening.
Lots of Asian restaurants, shops. Good amount of parking. 99 ranch market is a great place to find Asian food supplies

Be careful driving in this parking lot. Many people are not paying attention so it is dangerous. There is a grocery which has good prices on produce but there are much better grocery stores near by. In the mall there is a no. 1 boba tea which has great boba. They use honey to sweeten them which gives them an amazing texture
Not a complete trip to Vegas if you don’t stop for a couple hours here. Fast food to set down dinners priced from high to low.  If you want Asian food in Vegas this area is a good option
Love the place to eat lunch it dinner. Good 99 Ranch Market plus small indoor mall. Parking very tight and disabled parking hard to get.

Arrived to check-in at 7:20pm, was finally helped at 8:05pm. There are 7 staff members checking in folks. There are 17 check-in stations. They really need to up their staffing during these peak times. At check-in they highly suggest upgrading to elite rooms. Same size rooms, with nicer bedding, a fridge and bigger TV. Up too you if that's worth it. Not a bigger size or anything like that.

I have an oversized van so had to park across the street. Easy access, much appreciated. It was really neat to be walking up to the hotel and hear the screams of someone jumping over the edge (their skyfall attraction).

I noticed an ad for a rotating restaurant at the top. I hope to try it before I leave.

The casino is pretty standard fare, nothing special.

The Stratosphere is fun, a little bit pricey but if you like adventure it's worth it. We only went for the rides on the top and to jump off the side of the tower. We had a blast but also realized that we are adrenalin junkies and need more for it to be amazing. Don't get me wrong most people would call this an adrenalin rush! If you like feeling like a kid again, or are looking for a fun, but totally different way to get your night started I would recommended going!

Paid for a 10 day stay and was treated so poorly within those ten days. If we were able to cancel and stay somewhere else we would have... The first night we were here one of the dealers "Ralph" made me feel EXTREMELY UNCOMFORTABLE by hitting on me while I was standing with my boyfriend. My boyfriend told him that what he said was extremely disrespectful and unprofessional. The so called "pit boss" came over and when my boyfriend told him what Ralph said, he didn't say a word to us, no apologies or anything! Then the second day after room service came into our room my boyfriend's very expensive razor went missing we shrugged it off and assumed it was our fault. Few days later after our room was serviced again his deodorant went missing, again we shrugged it off. Few days later he goes to shave his face while having to hold his razor blade in his hand and his shaving cream is now gone. 3 times?! That was no coincidence. Fortunately the nicest person yet a manager named Riley made it right by crediting money back to our card to cover the cost of the items. We would gamble for quite awhile before bartenders would even come near us, most the time they just walked by ignoring us. Best part about this place is the free water you get while gambling if you can manage to get a cocktail server to get it.

The Stratosphere is fun, a little bit pricey but if you like adventure it's worth it. We only went for the rides on the top and to jump off the side of the tower. We had a blast but also realized that we are adrenalin junkies and need more for it to be amazing. Don't get me wrong most people would call this an adrenalin rush! If you like feeling like a kid again, or are looking for a fun, but totally different way to get your night started I would recommended going!

The staff was extremely helpful with no issues.  My only complaint was the time it took to check in on Thursday after 11pm. It took over an hour since the line was so long. This hotel and Casino had everything in it that if we didn't want to, we didn't have to go out for anything.  Rooms were very clean so I must shout out to the Housekeeper that cleaned room 11020 on the Select elevators side from 4/11-4/14/2019. She did an awesome job.  The buffet was great also.

The large central town square in Gyumri, Armenia. It is bordered by the Abovyan street from the west, Gai street from the north, Shahumyan street from the east and Vahan Cheraz street from the south. It has a rectangular shape (280 by 140 meters).
The square was known as the May Uprising Square, named after the failed Bolshevik uprising against the Dashnak government of the First Republic of Armenia in May 1920. The square was opened during the 1930s under the Soviet rule, based on the original plan of Alexander Tamanian and the revised plan of D. Chislian.
Красиво вообще классно
Սիրուն ա Գյումրին
Много интересного
Ponchik monchik,norlav tex e erexaneri het ponchik utelu hamar.
Pretty good multi-course meal for $40 here

Reallr, really, really bad. Terrible combination of flavors and ingredients. In a city like Atlanta, a restaurant like this shouldn't have lasted even a day. Even Peoria, IL has a better "spice market" than this joint. Save your $$ for the gazillion better options in ATL.

Having read the reviews here, and having dined at the original in NYC, I have to say that the variability of this branch of Chef Vongerichten's empire is its downfall. I dined here once and thought, "well anyone can have an off night", so I dined here again the next night and the experience on the front side improved, but the food was, to put it tactfully and gently, awful! They can't seem to put together a consistent service or kitchen staff. The food on my first time here this year (I have been here three times in the last year) was bland, poorly prepared, and the service was marked by an apparent lack of training and experience. Now, I realize this is Atlanta and not New York, and that good, professional help is scarce, but c'mon folks--this is supposed to be a high end place (the prices sure trend that way!). Have you ever heard of training and supervision of staff? You can do lots, lots better! When a customer shows up at the entrance with no one around, is noticed by several staff including the bartender, but still no one comes, that is a sign that the management of this restaurant either is unmotivated or clueless. Either way, much improvement is needed. Nonetheless, because I know and respect Chef Vongerichten's restaurants, and I was staying in the hotel, I decided to give it another shot. This time, I was greeted promptly, and the waitress who served me appeared professional, in addition to friendly. However, this time, the food was, to put it tactfully and diplomatically,  absolutely awful. Other than the appetizers and main course arriving together, which was something that should never happen--even in a restaurant that says it serves "family style" (by which I understand that the dishes are served to the table, not each individual diner), the food was simply bad. I had the chicken satay which was like eating pieces of rubber. I ate it because I was hungry, not having eaten since that morning. I had ordered sticky coconut rice wrapped in a banana leaf as a side, along with grilled halibut. Well, the sticky rice was so sticky I had to cut it with a knife to get a mouthful. The halibut was so overdone and dry that it, too, was inedible. I asked the waitress who was in the kitchen and she said the head chef (omigod! if this is what the top guy allows out his kitchen door to customers then this restaurant is in big, big trouble!). I communicated my issues to her and in a minute or so the manager appeared. I reviewed the problems with him and he was apologetic, but it remains to be seen whether this restaurant will ever rise much above the level (or to the level given, its current starting point) of Bonefish Grill or Cheesecake Factory, while charging prices far above those establishments. Thankfully, I did not have to pay for this meal, but I would have gladly paid for a meal that even came close to expectations of a restaurant in this restaurant group.
One last thing-I hate writing bad reviews. A bad review means that I had a bad experience in a place and at a time when the experience should be nothing but pleasant. Anyone who reads my reviews on TripAdvisor knows that I tend to be glowing in my praise when a restaurant provides a good experience. I want to appreciate, and can, any type of dining experience. I don't expect the local pit barbecue to be Per se, but I do expect any restaurant running under the banner of a fabulous chef like Jean Georges Vongerichten to be at least adequate. So, to write a review like this is both unusual and dismaying for me. I do hope, if I am at Spice Market Atlanta next year, that I will be able to retract this review and report a wonderful experience from service to food. I hope so.
trendy, hip, great food and service to matchy. when dining in the heart of midtown, who could ask for anything more.
small plates, over-priced, ok food

The food was delicious and our server, Jeremy was so nice. The dessert section of the buffet was unlike anything I’ve ever seen and tasty, to boot. The general ambience was great. The floral arrangements were beautiful! The only reason it loses a star is because the chefs at the cooking stations were not friendly. They all seemed gloomy and robotic, even when greeted with a friendly face.

I was pretty hesitant to try a buffet due to concerns about quality. So we picked the Wynn as it is a bastion of opulence. Unexpected standout was the buttermilk pancake topped with fresh strawberry compote and vanilla whipped cream. Our server Yasmin was fantastic. Would feast here again.

We went to The Buffet at the Wynn because we heard they offered good vegetarian and vegan options. Unfortunately there wasn’t much variety, and the veggie options were bland. The desserts were amazing, but I wanted something savoury and filling. I think people who eat meat would have more fun here. Ultimately, I don’t think the experience I had at The Buffet was worth the money I paid.

So we didn't have to wait in an outrageous line here, but the food was so so. We went on a Saturday night for the seafood night and were really excited about the snowcrab legs. Oh my goodness, they were salty and gross, and dried out and warm. No good. They did, however, have an awesome dessert selection. But the value for money wasn't there.
Was referred by many friends and we loved the place. Price is great and it’s One of best buffet in Vegas. Great selection of delicious food.. fast and very good service.

Was very impressed with the service. So classy, fun, and respectful. The staff all worked together to serve us, along with educating us about the menu. Not only remembered ever detail about us when I made the reservation. (Our name, our occasion) Great surprises brought to our table that I didn’t know was part of the meal. We sat outside on the patio. Such a great area to dine. We very much enjoyed our dinner and experience. Some music would of been perfect.
This place never disappoints you. It is pricey, so don't go unless you have an expense account or just won $10,000 on blackjack table. Fresh fish and really good pasta.

Service was horrible.  It seemed like their attitude is that you should be honored to dine with them. There was a larger party sitting next to us that they were fawning all over. 
It started when we were asked if we were staying at the Wynn and we said no. That was the first slap in the face that we did not belong. I guess the Venetian is not worthy. When the waiter came over with his fresh fish cart, he talked so fast, explained nothing. We were there because we had heard the fish was amazing, but they did not explain anything. I had heard from parents whom has dined there in the past how you choose your fish, they cook the whole fish and then prepare for you tableside. All they told us were the kinds of fish, and the cost per ounce?  They seemed to assume we were not worthy of Fish. They also did not like that we did not order a bottle of wine. Instead we ordered cocktails but that was not proper.  The food was average at best.  
I was so excited to dine at this restaurant and was so disappointed and very upset that we wasted a night out on this horrendous place.  Don't waste your time or money.
One of the best Dinning experiences I have ever had.  You must get the Beard Sampling menu.  The service is impeccable.  Great ambiance.  Be sure to get a table outside.

Simply superb !!!! The food was absolutely delicious, if not Michelin-starred when there was a guide there, then it would have been now. The setting downstairs (ensure you book a table downstairs and if possible by the window to look at the beautiful pond with the floating metal balls or outside around the pond when weather permits) is is very nice and service is outstanding. Prices are not cheap but matching the quality of the fish flown daily from Italy (or every other day, I cannot recall). I had a superb branzino and tasted the delicious langoustines the other guests had. Highly recommend.

To the Starbucks branch here at the Cesar's Palace food court, please hire people who do not have attitude and will not tell me that I am wrong when I try to order a "cupcake frappuccino." I was told that I ordered a "coffee frappuccino," which was completely different from what I said. The lady even shrugged me off when I explained what a cupcake frappuccino was! It was hilarious but frustrating at the same time! Also, PLEASE don't put these on your cups if your staff is not willing to "make it right." Thanks!

Might want to avoid this place. Pizza was poor, burgers are a rip, and noodles underwhelming. All in all, seems like a food court heavily overpriced and with poor standards of food.  At these prices, I would suggest you save your money and jump across the street for better value and better food.
Options here include Pizza DiFara, Earl of Sandwich, Smash burger, The Halal Guys, Tiger wok and ramen, La Gloria tacos and crepes which is connected to a Starbucks. As of Feb 2019!
Convenient and quick, with standard variety of choices. Burgers, pizza, Asian, crepes, Halal... Seems like it’s open round the clock.
Great facilities here. I love!

The atmosphere was vibrant and fun! The food was amazing! The drinks were good too! We were talking with people from the bar and having a great time. If you get a chance to swing in, I would recommend it!
The service was a little slow,  even though they weren't busy.  We still had fun! Good Key lime pie. Worth the stop. We enjoyed ourselves! 2 for 1 drinks,  ya gotta go at least once!
Cool decor. Preciseley what I expected. Perfect for lunch. I went for the Cuban Burger over the expected Cheeseburger in Paradise. Courteous staff. Stellar service!
One order, a burger, had to be sent back due to not cooked correctly. The jambalaya had little flavor.  Manager and waitress were both very good.

This is a nice bar with atmosphere to match. We were there a little before noon and it was almost full. A must stop in Key West. Ordered  sandwiches that were both very good. Make sure to order a "5 o'clock some where" if you go, it is an awesome drink.

I don't have the 30 minutes or more it would take to appropriately review this dining experience & proclaim the justice this restaurant deserves. The service was impeccable. The chef worked around several of my food allergies on multiple courses of the seasonal tasting menu. The cocktails were perfectly crafted, and there were wonderful culinary surprises waiting just around the corner with every new plate. One of the best dining experiences of my life.
Late dinner at the counter was superb. Casual atmosphere belies the expense. We overdressed. Top notch experienced servers. We loved every dish - impossible to pick a favorite.

The food is out of this world... the setting is very cool even for Vegas standards... And with the ability to check out the chefs as they create your dish in front of you.  Think modernist French sushi bar.... it's one of the most memorable restaurant experiences you can have.  I think it's one of the standards in which a high-end creative evening out is all about.

L'Atelier was the best restaurant I have ever been to. The service from Patrick and Oscar was perfect and they were very friendly. Executive chef Jimmy Lisnard was extremely friendly and took the dining experience to a another level. He even brought over the executive chef of the Joel Robuchon restaurant next door, Christophe De Lellis, and we were given an incredible tour of the kitchen. The food was amazing, the service incredible, and the experience was memorable. L'Atelier is a must for all who love fine dining and for those reading the negative reviews just ignore them because they depict the restaurant very inaccurately.
Wonderful dining experience! The food was delicious and the service was amazing! If you are doing the foodie Las Vegas experience this is definitely a must!

Breakfast was great!  Sweet cream pancakes were accurately named.
Fun atmosphere - I love diners.
Service was a bit slow after we received our meal.  Refills were slow.
Very friendly staff.

Food was good with large portions and the service was great. The only problem I encountered were the prices being very steep $93 for a party of 4. I think I could have had the same quality at Denny's for less than half the price.

Lucky indeed! Tasty food, great service, exceptional value equals one of the best under-rated casino cafe restaurants in Las Vegas! A secret menu (Steak and Shrimp dinner $7.77 still going strong) for Backstage E Pass members only can't be beat! Highly recommend! Update 1/8/19: No more Secret menu, $7.77 has been discontinued.
The food is quite average mass-produced fare so be prepared for that. Portions are large but if the taste is just OK where's the benefit? Waitstaff was very attentive.

The place is nice and friendly, food has a catchy presentation but no flavor. Domestic beer ($7.00) ridiculously expensive, but honest to say that I like the salad and the company of my beautiful wife.  Sadly to say that I don't recommend this restaurant. Pedro|Contreras
Very good Japanese restaurant. Great food and loads of options, all very tasty.

This little place is hard to beat. The chirashi sushi lunch set was a generous portion, high in quality, including the rice, and very fair in price.  The side dishes were equally good.  The service was prompt and friendly. I will be back to try some of their other dishes.
Food Fresh and People friendly
Great food. Slightly pricey
Great quality of menu, excellent service. Highly Recommended.

I'm originally from Chicago and relocated to Burlington to study at one of the local colleges. Upon my first semester in school, Red Square welcomed me to be a resident DJ at their venue - which later turned into two residencies per week. Red Square has always been there for me and helped me advance in my DJ passion and my efforts to be a professional marketer.

The Red Square environment is fun and exciting! As a DJ, I always see our guests enjoying themselves and having a memorable time. There are multiple stages in the venue that DJs and live bands perform on throughout the week. That being said, Red Square is the place to be for an array of music.
Great drinks & staff.  Always a good time!  Nothing better then a summer night having drinks on their patio and listening to music!!

I'm giving this 3 stars as bring a bit of an older couple it seemed more of a dive bar. they had live music which was fun, a lounge area and a dance and DJ area in the back. it seemed a little different than what we are used to and being a big beer drinker we stopped in for a drink. My fiance said the shock top didnt taste like normal and my ipa left a dry aftertaste in my mouth. so I'm not sure if I'd be returning. it was clean inside and friendly staff just not sure if it's a place for me.

WAY BIGGER THAN IT LOOKS! Step inside to a small dining like area and step up to the dance floor. A DJ room in the back corner and live music outside in the summer time. Only downside is the bathroom situation, (especially for gents apparently) but other than that, an awesome place to hang with friends.

What fun night life! We were in the area for a wedding and stopped in for late night drinks. The band you had was very entertaining and we ended up staying for a couple hours. Dancing, drinking, socializing...Thanks for the experience

Amazing service and delicious food! Yes it can be expensive but it totally worth it for a nice dinner date or night out! Strongly recommend strip house potatoes and the ny strip. The chocolate cake was also mouthwatering. Our waitress was great and the manager Daniel is very kind. Definitely a must when you visit Las Vegas.

Been to quite a few steak houses and this one can compete with all the top ones. Steak is of course not cheap but the prices were reasonable. Calamari was to die for. Also had the duck fat potatoes as a side which was quite tasty. The full staff was great. Everyone seemed to be pitching in.

Fantastic steak with the sides we got mac and cheese and asparagus; so delightful! We loved the old vintage photos decorating the inside.  The wait staff did a fantastic job anticipating our needs and we wanted for nothing!
Would have to be the best meal I have ever had. The filet minion was the amazing, service was great and not super expensive. Given it was about $65 for a meal, still worth the price.

Been here on multiple occasions now and both the food has been excellent. Rib eye 20 oz bone in and half dozen oysters are out of this world. Decor and ambiance is great. Service up to par. Pricey but worth every penny.
Such great burgers. I love the outside seating. The service was great. Our waitress was so genuine. It was really loud but I still give 5 stars.

Best burgers in all of Sin City! When I would stay at the Wynn, one of the most luxurious hotels on the strip (with some of the best restaurants), I'd walk across the street just to eat here! I recommend the Turkey Burger.

The was my first time, and this place was incredible. I had a burger, shake, and garlic herb fries. Every single thing was a 10/10, I definitely recommend this spot. Great food, just found another spot I will always have to visit when I’m Vegas
When you want a REAL meat quality burger in a fun atmosphere with strip seating...go here! Great people, excellent burgers and very reasonable! Love this place

I mean Talk about Burgers!!!!  They have some AMAZING Burgers I would definitely recommend this place! The Drinks was OKAY I switched back to my Whiskey and Coke because the ones they recommended me were not so great...  they were missing...   Alcohol

Very little going on at 6:00 PM on a Monday and service a little slow. Drinks good, enjoyed a Georgia Peach. Three stars for this visit. Have been in past on weekend night and live music was good... bar vibe more fun then.

Great meal, great service. Interesting reviews about slow service and blah food. Nachos were great and the service was super fast. My drink was refilled before I would consider it low. I'll go back next year.

I'm in the military and I went there with a group of guys. The so called American Soldier Burger, which is the free burger, was all bun, lettuce and tomato and pickles and a whole onion. I had to eat through half of the bun before I found the burger. I  would rather pay for a good meal. if, you don't really want to offer the free burger to military members anymore, then don't. Stop pretending to support us and then giving us lousy food and service

Don't know their Own Rules. Seated us and told us we were fine then very aggressively told us that we had to move. Because our son was 20. We weren't even sitting at the Bar and we made sure to ask if he could set with us as we came in they told us it was fine!! Guess they Lied!

Got sat quickly and a cool place. However, we waited a good 15-20 min and no one came over to us. Finally, we just walked out. It was Unfortunate because my wife and I were very excited about eating there.

The place is way more than just a view from the top of the world and everyone should visit if you haven't been. It has some good information about Maryland and people from there. It also has a really nice memorial in remembrance of 9-11.

Great Views of Baltimore City. It is worth the money. Honestly one of the best things to do in Baltimore. The 9/11 memorial is great at honoring the lives that we lost on that horrible day. Great place to take the kids! The elevator sure is an experience!
Amazing views. I got to learn a lot of Baltimore history and identify some key landmarks. Got a good price through Groupon right now. Must check it out

The view from up there is absolutely amazing! The cost is a little steep for the few "attractions" they have up there. It was chilling, because when you got off the elevator was a re-account of September 11, 2001. There's an amazing view of five different sides of Baltimore. You can see so far off in the distance. I definitely recommend it for anyone who just wants to sit there and take a deep breath and just be...
This is a really cool place to see the town and the harbor area. On a clear day you can see really far and a lot. I also like the all the artifacts they have from 9/11. Pretty cool place.

This place is great.  The food is a great price and the portions are huge.    Definitely recommend.   We had the hangover burger and the Frisco burger.   Both were delicious.  Staff is friendly and the atmosphere is very welcoming.

Excellent food options.  Village pub GREAT breakfast spot.  Julio’s tacos GREAT lunch spot.   Sports book rarely has a line.  Primary knocks would be poorly lit, the mildew stench at the back bar and drink tix are only good for house made beers.  Friendly service, seems like more of a locals hangout.

Amazing experience!  I was here for three nights and was truly treated like family the moment I arrived.  The dealers were very welcoming and Nancie in the Village Pub and Cafe was one of the best servers I have had in a long time.  Had great breakfasts everyday and perfect Fish and Chips for the one time I ate dinner there.  It is great to see that customer service is not dead in Vegas;  you just have to go to a family owned business to find it!

This place exceeds expectations! Had the $6.99 steak, was unreal . Great chicken and waffles! Very friendly staff and just and all round nice atmosphere. Definitely older dingy-er casino but it has charm. Our room seemed newly renovated and new bed. Can't get better bang for your buck!

Great place just a block from the strip. They have been voted best brewery in Las Vegas at least 4 times, and the beer is reasonably priced, around $2.50 a pint. They also have pizza, wings, and a small diner in the casino. The rooms are nice - cushy beds, free wifi, fridge, 40 inch TV - but just like any other basic room in town.

This place was a huge surprise! Had driven past it over many years but never gave it a second glance, it just looks so old school and nondescript. My buddy and I ate there because it was the only place open within walking distance on a cold evening. We enjoyed our appetizers and entrees very much. The "old school" atmosphere was very nice. Highly recommend this place.

Walking into the Golden Steer is taking a step back in time.  A time where service and quality reigned supreme.  The atmosphere is dark wood, leather tufted booths, waiters who every wish is to serve and soft lighting.  Excellent for a business dinner or romantic dinner.  The service is impeccable, the quality of the  food is above reproach.  Table side service for Cesar salad where they actually prepare the dressing from scratch as well as your salad..  My only regret is that I had but one meal there during my short stay in Las Vegas.  Highly recommend and will be sure to dine there every time I am in town.

A blast from the past, this old world steak house keeps it real. Steak was excellent, nostalgia decor was spot on. My only complaint are the sides, they could use some updating but don't touch anything else.

Leeann was an amazing server. She was attentive without being over-bearing. The shrimp appetizer is amazing - huge, old-school-Vegas-size shrimp. Highly recommend it for a night of great food and above exceptional service.
Great steaks in Las Vegas.  Service was really on point and made the experience even better.  It's not on the strip bit it's close and worth venturing out.

Always a great place for a party atmosphere. Such a fun place to go with a group. If you don't like it loud this place isn't for you. Good German food that's a bit pricey but you're paying for the entertainment aspects really.

A must try adventure in Vegas!

I'm not a beer drinker, and I don't like too much noise, so I went early to avoid the crowds. I wanted some good German food, and they didn't disappoint. The schnitzel and spätzle were both delicious, the wurst were fantastic, and the pretzel made me want to eat 5 more. The servers were very friendly and attentive. Wonderful place to visit, even if you're not into the beer/tavern scene.

Great food, very quick service. Traditional Octoberfest style seating. Friendly staff dressed in traditional garb. Live band that wasn't too loud. If I had to offer a criticism, the German rye bread was just a slice, not a warm, crusty miniature loaf. Still a great overall meal.

I have always had a great time here. Food is great, and the atmosphere is the best!

My only complaint is if you call for a reservation, ensure you request for the hall. I called, and was told it was not busy, so we did not need to make a reservation. We showed up and were told the only seats available were in the back biergarten.  

Service is great! No complaints at all, other than seating placement!

This place was amazing. I'm in Vegas on a work trip so had a group of 15 people. They easily accommodate big groups here. They have German music with entertainment the entire meal. The service was good, and the food was amazing. I'm super picky when it comes to food, but I ordered #365 and it was a pork platter with mashed potatoes and it's some of the best pork I've ever had will come back again next time in Vegas!

I ordered the namesake Pink Taco. Loved it. And the free salsa they give the table was some of the best I have had. Service could be improved though. Everything took at least 4 minutes, which might not seem like a lot, but when asking for a refill or just getting the check is forever.

We came in for dinner on a weekend night and it was amazing we had two entrées and enjoyed a flight of their tequila.  The waitress was very knowledgeable  and helped us with our choices and the food was amazing.  We then came back for happy hour and were again impressed by the wings and margaritas.  This place is very affordable for Vegas and provided strong drinks and incredible flavors. Great atmosphere!!

The Pink Taco is located in the Hart Rock Hotel, Las Vegas. Good cocktails, cold beer and delicious Mexican food are offered here. The staff is friendly, accommodating and always in a good mood ... and all at affordable prices!

I had the enchiladas, they were tasty, we ate here before the Raiding the Rock Vault show.  We were seated outside which was nice.  Margaritas were good, not great, but food prices were reasonable for Vegas.

This was my second visit to the PT and I am happy to report that the great experience I had on my first visit was no fluke. The service was fast and courteous and the food was excellent. These guys are not afraid of a little spice. The salsa and food were flavorful with the right amount of heat. The seasoned black beans were flavorful and cooked to perfection. I highly recommend the Pink Taco.
Worst restaurant ever!!
They just Reddit
Face it, you're here for the novelty of it.  The burgers are average but the fries (which are all you can eat and cooked in lard) are actually quite good.
No good..

Possibly the worst place in Arizona. You are required to use "washed gowns" in order to eat there. When I was there I asked not to wear the gown and they refused to serve me. After I pointed out two other patrons wore theirs in to the bathroom. Gross. Beware this is a major health problem.

Best frozen custard. They have received the Zagat award. I overheard a lady saying that now their kids are enjoying the frozen treats just like they did as kids. Been around for awhile. Sunday's they have Fresh Banana Nut.
You can check online for flavors since they change. So Yummy !!!
Frozen custard in a variety of flavors. Not really anywhere to sit and eat but you can order on postmates. They have individual sizes or large containers and also make sundaes.
Very filling delicious custard for a quick stop on the strip. I wouldn't go there regularly though, it's a bit too sweet for my taste
Classic Custard in Downtown Las Vegas.  Order your favorite at the window and then eat it your car. Location is shady but you should be fine during daylight hours.
Luv_It Frozen Custard is the best! Great place for those have sweet tooth. Absolutely a lovely place to visit for kids and adults.

Arrived to check-in at 7:20pm, was finally helped at 8:05pm. There are 7 staff members checking in folks. There are 17 check-in stations. They really need to up their staffing during these peak times. At check-in they highly suggest upgrading to elite rooms. Same size rooms, with nicer bedding, a fridge and bigger TV. Up too you if that's worth it. Not a bigger size or anything like that.

I have an oversized van so had to park across the street. Easy access, much appreciated. It was really neat to be walking up to the hotel and hear the screams of someone jumping over the edge (their skyfall attraction).

I noticed an ad for a rotating restaurant at the top. I hope to try it before I leave.

The casino is pretty standard fare, nothing special.

The Stratosphere is fun, a little bit pricey but if you like adventure it's worth it. We only went for the rides on the top and to jump off the side of the tower. We had a blast but also realized that we are adrenalin junkies and need more for it to be amazing. Don't get me wrong most people would call this an adrenalin rush! If you like feeling like a kid again, or are looking for a fun, but totally different way to get your night started I would recommended going!

Paid for a 10 day stay and was treated so poorly within those ten days. If we were able to cancel and stay somewhere else we would have... The first night we were here one of the dealers "Ralph" made me feel EXTREMELY UNCOMFORTABLE by hitting on me while I was standing with my boyfriend. My boyfriend told him that what he said was extremely disrespectful and unprofessional. The so called "pit boss" came over and when my boyfriend told him what Ralph said, he didn't say a word to us, no apologies or anything! Then the second day after room service came into our room my boyfriend's very expensive razor went missing we shrugged it off and assumed it was our fault. Few days later after our room was serviced again his deodorant went missing, again we shrugged it off. Few days later he goes to shave his face while having to hold his razor blade in his hand and his shaving cream is now gone. 3 times?! That was no coincidence. Fortunately the nicest person yet a manager named Riley made it right by crediting money back to our card to cover the cost of the items. We would gamble for quite awhile before bartenders would even come near us, most the time they just walked by ignoring us. Best part about this place is the free water you get while gambling if you can manage to get a cocktail server to get it.

The Stratosphere is fun, a little bit pricey but if you like adventure it's worth it. We only went for the rides on the top and to jump off the side of the tower. We had a blast but also realized that we are adrenalin junkies and need more for it to be amazing. Don't get me wrong most people would call this an adrenalin rush! If you like feeling like a kid again, or are looking for a fun, but totally different way to get your night started I would recommended going!

The staff was extremely helpful with no issues.  My only complaint was the time it took to check in on Thursday after 11pm. It took over an hour since the line was so long. This hotel and Casino had everything in it that if we didn't want to, we didn't have to go out for anything.  Rooms were very clean so I must shout out to the Housekeeper that cleaned room 11020 on the Select elevators side from 4/11-4/14/2019. She did an awesome job.  The buffet was great also.

Nice and quiet place with AIR CONDITIONING room where you can chill and talk about business in a convivial environment with affordable price and friendly staff members and it is located in the most frequently use road the Prince Louis Rwagasore Chausee
The food is great
My favorite place to be in bujumbura. Nice atmosphere, nice food and nice juice too!!!
Nice place
Good Cafe centre with reasonable price and service

Always a great time. My favorite place to play some black jack. Mary who has been with them is fantastic dealer. Since 1989 to be exact! 

I’ve also stayed here for a week last year and that was also a fantastic visit as well. Highly suggest staying here!

What a great hotel and casino!

The rooms are beautiful, the casino was a ton of fun, and the cravings buffet was delicious.

Everything across the board (for the most part) felt modern and up to date.

The hotel suite was spacious, and clean. Having a walk in closet as well a separate room for the toilet for showering and bathing was amazing.

The casino was a lot of fun, even if we did leave Vegas a bit in the negative. Carl (one of the security guards) was a definite highlight. He came by randomly, asked if we were celebrating any birthdays.. We were, and he sang to her! Great voice, and greater personality! He went on to thank us for being guests as well. It was great! Thanks Carl!

The only issue we ran into while at the mirage was when we went to see the dolphins.. The gentleman running the centre ticket booth Sunday morning was very rude with us.

The pool is one of the best on the strip. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the bed was comfortable as well. Quickly becoming one of my favorites on the strip!Always a great time. My favorite place to play some black jack. Mary who has been with them is fantastic dealer. Since 1989 to be exact! A great place to stay--and in the middle of the strip! Overall a great experience. The room was clean and stylish. The staff were delightful to chat with and made great recommendations on dining and entertainment other than gambling.

I have been to most of the hotels in the strip and I absolutely loved staying here. The location is fabulous. The service and atmosphere is fabulous. I've eaten at three of the restaurants and enjoyed the food at each of them. The pool is one of the best on the strip. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the bed was comfortable as well. Quickly becoming one of my favorites on the strip!

Rooms were very nice and clean. Casino was nicely laid out and was a fun time. Food was good through the hotel/casino as well. Spa area was very very nice. Lost a star for me because the cocktail service was extremely slow while gambling, and the waitresses were not that humble or nice.

Best hotel in old Vegas. I love the nugget and the old charm. The staff is friendly and helpful and we just can’t get enough of the tank in the pool area. So fun! The rooms are clean and the hotel is meticulously maintained inside and out. The casino staff are friendly and the front desk staff are so great and accommodating. We have already booked our return to this hotel on our next trip to Vegas.

If anybody is trying to find good deals for hotels visit HotelBuIly. com booked a hotel on there and they had the best rates anywhere!

Stayed in the Golden Tower! The room was Outstanding! They have a great club upstairs Troy Liquor Bar that overlooks Fremont St. Service was excellent at the front desk. The property is amazing! I cant wait to try out the water slide that goes through the aquarium. Old Vegas is way cool!

Great place to stay if you want to get away from the strip. First time staying off of the strip and it was a great experience. Affordable places to eat and a decent pool to go with it. Walk out the front doors of the casino and you're on Fremont Street! Always something to do, or just people watch! Would definitely stay here again

We had a very nice experience at The Golden Nugget. The room was well kept and comfortable. The swimming pool is very unique with a large shark tank in the center! There is dining, shopping and a casino. It’s located on Fremont street so there is always something fun going on just outside the doors of the resort. Check in was easy and parking is free for those staying at the resort. We will definitely be back!

I did not give 5 stars for a reason.  Twice I kindly asked the housekeepers to freshen my room.  My bed did not even get made.  (Not once in my entire 3 night visit) The cosmetic mirror was dirty from the last occupant?   Ugh!!.  I love staying downtown, but when I book again I will not be staying at Carson Tower.  To be fair, the food at. Vic & Anthony's was amazing.  Jose the bartender is a terrific gem off a soul.  The steak was wagu beef and the best if my life.  The ambiance is warm and comfy.
